bibl.title: Letter from Frank F. Law to Philip Showalter Hench, November 30, 1944

div1.p: Law informs Hench about his meeting with Ramos and describes his ideas for exploiting the yellow fever painting in Cuba. Law requests that Hench contact Ramos to find out about the progress on this project.

div1.head: Letter from Frank F. Law to Philip Showalter Hench, November 30, 1944
div1.opener:
Wyeth INCORPORATED
W
1600 ARCH STREET · PHILADELPHIA 3 · PA·
November 30, 1944
Lt. Col. Philip S. Hench
Chief of the Medical Service
Army & Navy General Hospital
Hot Springs National Park, Arkansas
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I read your letter of November 23 with great interest, and
I had the pleasure of sitting next to Dr. Domingo Ramos of Cuba when
we recently awarded the Gorgas Medal to Commander James Sapero at the
Convention of Military Surgeons. Surgeon General Kirk was at my left
and Dr. Ramos asked me to ask Dr. Kirk to send you to Cuba in connec-
tion with some ideas he has for exploiting the Yellow Fever painting.

I immediately did so, telling Dr. Kirk that you were the ad-
visor on this picture and also gave the dedicatory address at its un-
veiling and the correctness of the whole ceremony so impressed Dr.
Ramos that he wishes to have a similar ceremony in Cuba. The Surgeon
General told Dr. Ramos that he was sympathetic toward the idea and sug-
gested that he (Dr. Ramos) write to him formally and he felt sure it
could be arranged.

Nothing would please me more than to join the group on that
occasion and I think a note from you to Dr. Ramos, inquiring as to the
progress of his work and whether he has written to Washington on that
matter, would be in order.

In compliance with your suggestion, we are sending a complete
set of paintings to Dr. White in Washington and I am also having sent
to your officehome in Rochester copies of “The Dawn of Abdominal Surgery”
and “The Father of American Pharmacy.” Just as soon as “Oliver Wendell
Holmes” is completed, I shall see that a copy goes out to you.
With kindest personal regards, I am
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, WYETH INCORPORATED
Frank Law
Vice-President FFL:s
